cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move north-northwest across Haiti and eastern Cuba, then track through the Bahamas and turn parallel to the Florida east coast toward coastal Georgia and South Carolina late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of northeast Florida/southeast Georgia (near or just east of Port of Brunswick, GA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet (only for Cuba, Bahamas, Turks & Caicos)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet (warnings confined to Haiti, eastern Cuba and portions of the Bahamas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Thursday night, with a 24% peak onset probability; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center stays close to the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation above 3 ft possible along the Georgia barrier islands, especially around high tide Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain associated with Matthew could easily total more than 4 inches, producing localized flash flooding in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible port access restrictions and berth closures due to swell and elevated water levels.
